Articles.Content:
i need a rover for the "send science from eve surface" contracts... i've already a small one on eve but i want to go bigger ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

the interplanetary stage (old version). i updated it with 4 small tanks in the heavy tank. got 3000m/s for the transfers... i was at 0m/s... needed everything...

![screenshot371.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot371.png)

with the decoupler i made the last course correction... with that (decoupling while facing to eve) i got the landing place out of the water to the coast ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

see gilly rise in the background ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![screenshot372.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot372.png)

the heatshield and the fairingshield was decoupled together at the time when the drouge chute was safe to open. it was a little bit out of control but it was able to manage that when the normal cutes opened.

![screenshot375.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot375.png)

with 2.9m/s desending. waiting for touchdown.

![screenshot376.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot376.png)

"landing confirmed" - i used the engines of the crane to try to decrease the landingspeed... i does nothing (probably 0.1 to 0.2 m/s)...

![screenshot377.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot377.png)

after doing the science of the "crane" - i needed the antenna of the rover - i powered the engines to full throttle and decoupled. the crane rolled over the front from the rover. lucky the rover took no damage...

![screenshot378.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot378.png)

doing science... yay!

![screenshot379.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot379.png)

when the rover needs more power he can extend another solar panel. but he have to be stopped for that. otherwise the panel will break off...

now i will hammer the same rover with the same stage to duna. should be possible. but i have to use the engines of the crane for the descending. i hope they are strong enough.

looking forward to that

and now also on duna. but i have to drive carfully... i think he can flip... (but shouldn't...)

going to duna (this is the up2date version)

![screenshot381.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot381.png)

arriving at duna.

![screenshot383.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot383.png)

deployed chutes after seperating the heatshield and the fairng (heatshield wasn't used...)

![screenshot384.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot384.png)

descending with 8m/s... thats fast. the rover will bounce off. so timing is all... the breaking engines are to weak... i have to tweak that... they arent able to slow the rover down to 4m/s...

![screenshot385.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot385.png)

doing science ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![screenshot386.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot386.png)

front and back lights ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![screenshot387.png](http://www.omfg.ch/ksp/everover/screenshot387.png)

the whole craft is up to 200'000 funds... not that much as i think ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Nice rover!

Hope you don't mind if I (steal) am inspired by your rover!

of course not. i can upload the rover if you want!

take all you want!

i have build this idea also on other ideas (for ideas the "kassandra" of H2O is awesome!)

edit: beside his weight - he is tricky to drive on duna. don't know but i think i can manage to flip if i would like to. but when you drive carefully than it's not a problem... important: toggle torch on the unmanned command pod... otherwise he will flip on kerbin ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). all reaction wheels have to be desabled.

also i just activated steering on the frontwheels and motor only on the rear wheels.

the interplanetary rhino has a thrustlimit of 49.5

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-15T11:44:04Z" title="07/15/2015 11:44  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 15, 2015</time> by KingPhantom**
